page.title: 13FARMING IN HARNHILL (CONT).
page.content: In the latter part of 1984, Mr Henly was joined by a daughter and son-in-law,who foresee a possible fundamental change in the Harnhill farming system for the future. EEC cereal production is already in surplus to demand and a likely consequence may be either quota restrictions or lower cereal prices, or both; but the family are also aware that there is a rising demand for organically grown milling wheat. In response to this prospect,on a small scale initially, some 15 acres of land are being prepared to qualify for the large 'organic premiums' which apply to organically grown milling wheat. (Continued on page 14)
